author: Special Correspondent
text:
Activist Teesta Setalvad, who has been targeted by the BJP government, found her name dragged into a fierce debate in the Lok Sabha on Wednesday when Human Resource Development Minister Smriti Irani blamed her predecessor Kapil Sibal under whose watch prescribed training manuals for teachers had perhaps prejudiced young minds to raise ‘anti-national slogans’ as university students later.

Ms. Irani drew the attention of the House to the dilemma posed by books on history prescribed for teachers for tutorship.

She picked up sections from books written by Ms. Setalvad for teachers under the Teacher Training Manuals prescribed for schools in Mumbai.

The one Ms. Irani chose were meant for children of Class IV, prescribed for Don Bosco School in Mumbai, with the question: when we teach Shivaji, which Shivaji do we take to the classrooms.
title: Teesta gets name dragged into House slugfest
